definition[0]: if police or soldiers round up a particular group of people, they find them and force them to go to prison
example[0]: Thousands of men were rounded up and jailed.
definition[1]: to find and gather together a group of people, animals, or things
example[1]: See if you can round up a few friends to help you!
example[2]: His dog Nell started to round up the sheep.
definition[2]: to increase an exact figure to the next highest whole number
definition[3]: a short description of the main parts of the news, on the radio or on television
example[4]: First, with a round-up of the day’s local news, here’s Paul Kirby.
definition[4]: when people or animals of a particular type are all brought together, often using force
example[7]: The IRS allows you, when calculating a partial deduction, to round up to the next $10. Thus, $301 becomes $310.
